intro: Pouteria euphlebia var. typica, commonly known as the Brazilian nut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Amazon Basin. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves. The tree produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that develop into hard, woody fruits containing a single large seed, known as the Brazil nut. The plant is valued for its economic importance as a source of the edible Brazil nut. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and commercial contexts.
